Title: Not worth it
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
Body: I got this for a heavy black friday discount and had high hopes. But ti really wasnt worth it for me.They stay in my ears until i laugh, chew, or im doing a workout. And then im fighting to keep them in my ear until I find the exact spot they sit comfortaby.And then if im constantly adjusting, my fingers hit the button no matter how i hold the earbuds. And of course when I want them to register my finger input, im pressing 3-4 times for it to notice. And then if im double tapping to skip to the next song, it only registers the first one and then pauses the music.Long story Short,im returning these. If you have a lot of patience, then get these. If not, i recommend getting ones that are smaller/sit in the ear better

Title: PAINFUL
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Body: I’ve tried to wear these for days hoping my ears just needed to get used to them but they’re not. Nobody mentioned how terribly uncomfortable and painful these were in the reviews. I’ve tried wearing them with and without the ear tips and they’re still extremely uncomfortable and painful. I will be returning them.

Title: Ear buds are painful!!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
Body: I like everything about these Barbuda except that they are incredibly painful to wear! I've tried all 3 sizes provided (horribly smashed, btw) and all 3 cause extreme pain. I've had to use a pair from an old set which provides slight comfort but only for a limited time. I cannot wear these for more than 10 mins without extreme ear pain. It feels like there's a plastic seam that just rubs the inside of the ear and it hurts! If I can't figure out a solution, I will have to return these. Very disappointed 😞

Title: Not as very good as the reviews made them out to be
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2023
Body: The aesthetic of the earbuds is pretty nice, I enjoy the color and sleekness to it and think its overall visual design isn't bad at all. I especially like how you can see the battery life of the earbuds, which was the feature I was most attracted to, but that's really where my compliments end, and the only reason why I bothered giving an extra star.The earbuds are pretty uncomfortable if you have smaller ears. They feel tight and overly stiff and will make your ears feel on the sore side with extended use. Which is a shame, because again, visually, they look quite nice. They come off quite easily in my experience, so working out and running wouldn't be the best use of these headphones. It doesn't feel secure at all to my ears, but it could also simply be because they don't fit smaller ears in general too well.Secondly, the sound quality isn't very good at all. It sounds muffled and cheap, not something worth around a $30 price point. If you're not someone who cares about sound quality and just want a working pair of wireless earbuds that get the job done though, and you don't mind the muffled-ness, I can see this being a decent pair of headphones for you.Thirdly, I noticed pretty quickly, almost immediately actually, that the battery drains rather quickly. Not even a full 3-5 minutes had passed before it dropped 5%, which may not sound like a lot, but compared to other wireless headphones I've used its rather quick. Even now it's dropped 10% in 10 minutes and I haven't even used/touched it in that time.Overall, I think it's better to find a better pair of earbuds for half the price because there are much better options out there. For the price point, it isn't worth it, and I'm pretty disappointed considering all of the positive reviews.

Title: Earbuds That Fail At Being Earbuds
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
Body: The worst pair of earbuds I've gotten outside of the kind of convenience stores that have sticky floors and a vague smell of malaise.The audio quality listening to music was meh.  On phone calls, no one could understand me because the microphone volume would go in and out.  Even wearing a properly fitted rubber tip, they don't stay in your ears.  I had mine for less than 48 hours before one fell out and immediately ran off to the magical land that your ballpoint pens and socks disappear to.

Title: Not good for audiobooks
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2023
Body: I use headphones primarily for audiobooks (and phone calls if someone calls while I’m listening to one). I can’t speak for the call quality because I listened for 2 minutes before deciding to return these. There is an ever-present background noise/static in these earbuds. I have really good hearing (probably to make up for my crappy eyesight lol), so maybe not everyone can hear it, but it is extremely noticeable and distracting to me when listening to audiobooks.As a test, I tried a short YouTube video and didn’t notice it as much (there is constant music/talking in most videos that mostly drowns out the static noise). But for audiobooks where the sound is just one person’s voice+pauses while they narrate, these are not the earbuds for that.My previous earbuds (that had great sound quality for the same price) were broken accidentally and that earbud brand is no longer available on Amazon, so I tried these after reading the good reviews. Bummer that they didn’t work out. My journey to find a suitable replacement continues.Giving the product 2 stars instead of 1 because their warranty is lifetime, even if lost, which I don’t see offered often. Also comes with a (very short) charging cord (my last pair did not come with one) and multiple rubber cone sizes for your ears. The shipping was extremely fast (same day) and the color options are cute. So two stars for those things, but with the sound quality being what it is (on audiobooks especially), I can’t say it “meets expectations” as one would expect from a 3 star rating.

Title: Keeps Falling Out
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
Body: My husband and I have a different sleep cycle and I get up way early.  I purchased these so that I could listen to TV and do quiet stuff around the house without waking him.  No matter what I do, these ear buds keep falling out.  I've tried all the different sizes and the only way these stay in my ears is to not move.  Anytime I get up to do anything they fall out.  If they stayed in I would like them much better.

Title: Even on sale, it wasn't worth it.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
Body: I got these on sale since I needed a quick replacement pair of earbuds. They didn't fit in my ears nearly as well as I'd hoped. The buttons on the side for pausing/unpausing were awkward to use from a lack of a physical button and a solid 2.5 second delay between input and response. The audio quality was also very poor, with songs sounding muffled and fuzzy like they were coming from the other side of a wall late at night. At least the battery life is good.

Title: Garbage.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024
Body: I’m giving this two stars because the connection process was easy. Once connected, these were a severe disappointment from a sound perspective. I’d rather listen to my music on a 1970s era transistor radio as it would have more bass. I got wooed by the price and got burned.

Title: Controls have very poor response
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2024
Body: I'm constantly having to tap, tap, try again, hold my finger down, try tapping again... once in a while it works, but if I'm driving and need to answer a call this is NOT going to work. It's very frustrating just watching videos! The sound has little bass. Returning.

Title: Great Earbuds!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
Body: These are amazing - especially for the price. I can easily take calls on my phone, or my computer. Listen to music while I'm out and about. I fly a lot for work and these earbuds are comfortable. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I have super small ears. Even with the smallest silicone inserts, they get pushed out of my ears after about 45 minutes of use. For longer durations, I just use my over-the-head headphones which I prefer anyway. But these are wonderful!

Title: For the most part they're good
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
Body: I only have 2 problems with them (as of the day of receiving them):1. They're always loud. Even on the lowest volume setting I can have them on before they stop playing audio altogether (until I turn the sound back up)2. I wish there were left-right indicators on the earbuds themselves. I'm kinda dumb and can't really tell which earbud is supposed to go in which ear until I actually put them in.3. (Not really an issue but it's still something I'd like to talk about): the touch controls are definitely something to get used to. One thing I've also noticed is that you can only use the earbuds to adjust the volume of there's any media playing. Otherwise it won't work at all.4. The earbud case battery also drains a bit too quickly for comfort. Other than that, everything's fine so far.

Title: Everything is getting smaller, is it really worth it?
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2024
Body: They work great. My only complaint is they are so small that every time I grab them I touch a different control and change something even while just trying to push them back in my ears. There are a number of control built into the head sets pieces. Once you start your machine most everything can be controlled from touching the ear pieces.

Title: Earbuds for small ear canals
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2024
Body: I hate when I put in eabuds, and they proceed to fall out of my ears even when I use the smallest size. The true wire Earbuds have been in my ears since I took them out of the box and have not fallen out yet which is a record. I know I am going to enjoy listening to my podcasts and music with these earbuds because I won't have to keep looking for them or pausing whatever I am doing. I might get some things done quicker.

Title: Great for the price
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2024
Body: My wife is always losing headphones so after losing multiple more expensive ones she uses these and loves them just as much and still hasn’t lost them. Battery life is good sound quality is decent only complaint is it is hard for the person to hear you on the other end of there is any background noise it starts to mesh together.

Title: UPDATE: my bad, they work fine.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
Body: so.... my bad. I did not have my PC bluetooth antenna hooked up properly. Which is strange bc i work with computers for a living. anyway, the ear buds work actually super well with my pc now and are my go to for zoom calls.good job guys and i apologize for the initial negative reviewignore previous review below.works great as earbuds for a phone, but do NOT try to use them with a PC or laptop. For whatever reason in this situation their range is axed to like 6", and they cut in and out constantly if your head isn't right next to your computer. It makes zoom calls so insanely frustrating.

Title: Really solid choice for wireless earphones!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2024
Body: I use these EVERY DAY! I love them. The only issue I have is that sometimes the mic works seamlessly, sometimes, I have to disconnect and reconnect. But for the price, they're really solid!

Title: Only connects to 1 device
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2024
Body: A little disappointed, because another Bluetooth earbud device I have can connect to both my cellphone and my tablet at the same time, but this earbud does not. I have to disable Bluetooth on one device in order to be able to manually connect it to the other device.

Title: Sometimes have to re-pair
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2024
Body: Sound is great.  Fit well in the ears/stay put pretty well.  Biggest issues - I have to re-pair with my device once in a while and the microphone for phone calls isn’t always clear for the listener.  Overall, I’m super happy and would buy these again.

Title: Pretty good
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Body: I think these AirPods are pretty Good the quality is pretty good they are very loud, the audio is clear enough for me. For the price they work very well.

Title: Great value for the money
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
Body: They are a great value.  Connect well and sound good.  The audio when speaking on the phone is not great, but sufficient, especially considering the cost.

Title: Great for price.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
Body: Very good battery life and quality. Only thing it needs improvement on is the mic. Im very low and unclear sounding on the other end of a convo.

Title: Warranty
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2024
Body: The buds are fine. And work well so far, but the "Lifetime Warranty costs $49.99 and you can buy new ones for less than 1 months Warranty, LOL.

Title: Mostly satisfactory
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
Body: They sound good, they're comfortable, the price was right and I'll keep them.  The wireless charging feature is questionable ... they stalled out at 81%, never got any higher and generated considerable heat in the process, but I do appreciate the  clear status readout ... connected to a USB cable they charge up to 100% very quickly and deliver good sound for longer than I'm used to with earbuds

Title: Touchy touch feature
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
Body: These area a great affordable set! They have excellent sound quality and an impressive battery life! My star deduction is for the touch feature.  Sometimes a wisp of hair or a strong breeze will cause an unexpected pause while other times I'm tapping the crap out of them and nothing happens.  This is definitely annoying.  BUT, for the price this is an excellent buy and I would definitely recommend for anyone on a budget!

Title: Good product compared to others
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2024
Body: This is better compared to more expensive comparable products I bought. However, it only works on my Ipad and I can't use it on my Google phone.

Title: Clear audio either a long battery life
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2024
Body: I like the noise cancelation and that I can tap to end music or to play.  Is small and neat.  Audio is clear.

Title: Great sound
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
Body: Great sound, easy pairing and awesome battery life. Some trouble figuring out the operating of functions and unfortunately hurt my ears. But most earbuds do. Need to try a different type. Still using these just not for long periods.

Title: Pretty darn good for the price
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024
Body: These have already lasted longer than any other cheap pair I've purchased.  Better quality sound than I expected.  I love how you can just put them back in the little case and the little case recharges them.

Title: Poor noise cancelling
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
Body: Great battery life and the case charges the earphones well. Good bluetooth and connects automatically to device when you open the case.These are cheap headphones in price and value.Poor noise canceling, people have a hard time hearing me if I'm outside or on the bus because of the background noise.If I'm speaking softly (if someone is sleeping in the other room) the earphones don't pick up the sound well.

Title: These work, but a couple of things you should know...
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2022
Body: I bought these after dropping my Apple Air Pods in a bowl of marinade (FYI - They are not oil proof). I figured if I was going to be doing dumb things like that, I shouldn't be spending $150 on headphones. So I found these which were a bargain at $30.I've been using them for a couple of months now and I've noticed a couple of unusual things:1. Unlike Air Pods, these will not automatically stop playing if you take one of the ear buds out. The Apple ones will automatically pause whatever you are listening to if you take one out. A couple of times these did stop playing when I took them out, but most of the time they don't.2. I've discovered that occasionally, even if I pause what I'm listening to, take the headphones out and put them in their case, sometimes they will begin playing again all on their own, even though they are in the case. I realized that after I went back to pick up where I left off in my audio book and found that it had been playing for more than an hour and I had to go back and figure out where I was in the book.3. Occasionally, not all the time, after I pause what I'm listening to and take the headphones out, the music or audiobook will all of a sudden start up again but play out of my phone speaker, not the headphones. It's a little awkward at work when that happens, especially if I get up from my desk and walk away only to find when I come back that my phone has been playing my audio book out loud the whole time.4. Most annoying of all: Sometimes I will put the headphones on, and it will start playing really loud and will not allow me to turn it down. The headphones will say "Volume Maximized" while it's blasting my ear drums. I try to turn it down on my phone and see that the volume goes down, then the headphones bring it back to full volume and again scream at me "Volume Maximized". It's awful.The only good thing I can really say about these is that they were cheap. I would not recommend them to anyone now that I've had a chance to use them for a while. I'm probably going to start looking for an alternative.

Title: These last two months max
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2024
Body: Second set died 45 days after I received them as a replacement for the first set that did the same thing. They’ll drop connection in the middle of a speaking on the phone and don’t even think about trying to connect and put them in your ears after you’ve already picked up a call. They won’t connect properly mid call without having to switch several times between audio sources until they finally decide to work. I knew I should have just purchased a set of AirPods but I got these trying to save money. Well ya get what you pay for. And it’s too late to return them.  Junk.

Title: Waterproof? Not whatsoever....
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
Body: I bought these as a replacement so I could have music for working out.I AM A SWEAT-ER IN THE GYM.... If you are too, try something else. I had a pair and after a week of cardio and weights, one ear bud went out in a blaze of glory by the volume shooting up in ear to the max before dying completely. Then, you put it in the case and it becomes a blackhole and sucks the energy out of the case and still doesn't charge. Thought it was a fluke, returned them and started fresh.New day! Similar results... A very annoying thing about these is when you put them in the case, they stay connected to your phone so if you're in the vicinity of your earbuds watching social media videos, they're silent and you don't know why. Then you have to unnecessarily deal with that.My 2nd pair just died and it's outside the return window. We'll see what happens. They're decent if you use them for everyday use and don't sweat in your cubicle. "Value for the money" is true.

Title: Can't stop it from blasting music when I put them in
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
Body: They work fine as headphones for music and calls although sometimes the controls can be accidentally activated by touching the headphones as you put them in.The big problem is that if I put them on without audio already playing on my phone, the headphones blast the first song in my Apple Music at full volume.  After two weeks, I can't figure out how to stop it, so I'm just going to have to get a different pair of earbuds.

Title: Sound ok. Battery time not so good.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
Body: I always check the items that have most purchases and then by their score. I saw this item had both, so I went for it. I am a big music fan and listener and that's the main reason why I got this earbuds.. the sound quality it's ok, not great as I expected, I want my ears to rattle when I listen to a good bass song... Maybe I am being picky but these buds didn't meet my expectations.Battery time is also not so good. Only lasts for half a day when other earbuds out there lasts way more... Not a big fan, will not keep them long.Luckily for me I got other earbuds that are slightly better than this ones.

Title: Awful
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
Body: I got these because the waterproof level indicated for them in the listing means they should be able to be used in the shower. About 2 weeks after I began wearing them the right earbud stopped taking a charge, and then stopped working altogether. The left earbud still works but 1) the sound quality is TERRIBLE - there is far too much bass in these. I guess that would be appealing for some types of music but I use them for podcasts and it made it so I couldn't understand so much of what was said. And 2) sometimes it starts turning up the volume for no reason and I can't get it to stop. Fun fact: when it reaches the maximum volume on your device, it starts screaming "MAXIMUM VOLUME" into your ear, at maximum volume, over and over and over as if that's any better than just listening to your music or podcast at maximum volume. And it doesn't stop until you turn your volume down, and in my case the earbud would continue to force the volume back up again on its own. I'd have to (in the middle of my shower) disconnect the earbud and reconnect it again in order to make it stop. My guess is that the 2nd earbud will stop working within the next month.

Title: Won't keep a charge
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2024
Body: I bought one of these a couple of years ago and absolutely loved it and still use it all the time. This last one I bought will not keep a charge. I took it on vacation and couldn't get the ear pieces to charge. I plugged it in multiple times and it says it's charged at 100%, but I put the earbuds in and they keep saying low battery. 😒

Title: Broke pretty quickly
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024
Body: Loved these little things when I first got them. Decent sound, cool little charging case. Carried a charge for a decent amount of time.About 3 or 4 months in the right earbud stopped charging. It's dead and there appears to be no way to fix it. Now I only had one working bud, man. Not terrible for calls or podcasts but I paid for two, damn it.

Title: Good sound, bad microphone
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2024
Body: Nice little head phones, ear buds, but the microphone seems to be spotty.  Good for listening to music, sound is find, but when use them with phone or computer phone, people on the other end say the mic is cutting in and out, even though sound is still good.  So not sure about using them for two way conversations.

Title: Great for listening , but not for phone call
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2024
Body: With more and more complaining about poor voice heard from the other side when having a phone call, while the voice is perfect heard on the other side when switching to my iPhone speaker mode, I just realized it should be the problem of this BT earbuds. I wish I happen to get a faulty one.

Title: A very good set of earbuds for a fair price
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
Body: I have Samsung and AirPods Pro that I use every day. I needed one more set of earbuds, less expensive, to carry with me. I must say that I am impressed with the quality of this product. I had no issues with paring, charging, or using it. I do not know how long exactly the charge lasts, but I take 2-hr walks and use these earbuds for at least this long without needing to recharge them. I am pleased with my purchase and would recommend this product to others. Sometimes, fortunately, you do not need to pay top dollar to get a good quality gadget.

Title: Tagry X08’s.  👍
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2024
Body: Just got these today.  They paired quickly to my iPhone 12 and my laptop.  Immediately queued up some nirvana.  For 34 bucks I was amazed how good they sounded.  I then went to my laptop to see how they were on a Dan Bongino Rumble podcast.  Once again, the speech was crisp.  The lifetime warranty took about 5 seconds to complete.  My only issue is the controlling of functions by tapping a specific spot on the ear buds.  This seemed clunky but it’s probably due to the fact I’ve never used wireless earbuds.  They were comfortable and the sound really impressed me.  Not sure how you can go wrong with these considering the lifetime warranty.

Title: Great Bang for the Price!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2024
Body: I have two sets of apple pods; one is missing, and the other will no longer pair with anything! I did not want to spend the $$ on another one right now, but I needed something that would pair with my desktop and have a great sound. I bought these and am VERY satisfied with the quality. I like that you can see a digital readout for the life left in the case. However, the one drawback is that the case has no weight. I would be afraid to drop it instead of my Apple earbud cases.

Title: They are great including the mic
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2024
Body: I have been really impressed with the quality of these earbuds and even more impressed with the mic. This was the feature that I was most concerned with for hands free calling and they have worked really great. I’ve used them for video conferencing and the sound quality is excellent, both incoming and outgoing. I’m tempted to buy another set just in case these ever go out. I’ve never used AirPods so I can’t give an accurate comparison but for this price point and quality I would definitely recommend these.

Title: Great value for the price
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
Body: These replaced my very old Totu ones and I am very happy with them. They automatically connect to my phone as soon as I take them out of the case.  The quality of sound on phone calls (all I currently use them for) is good.  I usually use both but they work with just one if you need to hear surroundings. Since I leave them plugged in when not in use, I can't comment on battery life.

Title: Suprisingly Great Quality For Price
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
Body: I got these wireless earbuds for my boyfriend as a Christmas present and he LOVES them. He had AirPods for a little while and he says he likes these BETTER than his previous AirPods because he likes that he can see the battery percentage on the case, they stay charged for such a long time, and they charge very quickly. The only flaw might be that sometimes it’s hard to hear him when I’m calling him, but that could be other contributing factors (like he has an old iPhone 6, uses them while riding a motorcycle, or bad service, he mumbles sometimes) and not necessarily the devices fault but otherwise I can here him perfectly. These are surprisingly great quality for the price. I would recommend getting the warranty just in case though, because they are cheaper than competitors but otherwise it’s a great product. They’re not noise canceling but I don’t think they’re advertised to be noise canceling. Overall they work exactly as advertised.

Title: They work flawlessly and for the price are unbeatable !
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
Body: I got these earbuds last year using them on my samsung S9 first and then on my Iphone 14 pro later and they worked flawlessly for 10 months and then one day the phone begun to not recognize the bluethooth on them even doing different reset on the earbuds and on the phone so I email the company and they quickly replied suggesting me some trouble shoot to fix the problem but nothing worked out so they sent me a new pair in a few days without any problems and the new pair is working better than the previous one. Really professional company with a really affordable price! 100% recommended!

Title: Survived the washing machine
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
Body: I left the case in pockets of my pants and had the ear buds on my dresser. Without realizing, I threw the pants into the wash and I was still able to use the earbuds! When I went to empty the laundry, I found the case at the bottom of the washer to my surprise! 😁 Needless to say, I ordered a second pair of these the same day

Title: Great quality for the price!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2024
Body: I wasn’t expecting these to be as good of quality for the price, but based on the good reviews I decided to try them, and really love them! They stay charged for a long time.  They are comfortable and have good sound.  Bought additional pairs for our kids; not going to spend a lot since they can lose them easily.  I recommend these!

Title: Great Product and Great Customer Service
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
Body: This is a great product with great customer service!  They reached out to me immediately after I left them a voicemail.  They texted me information so they could send me a charger because I did not think I received the charger.  It turns out it was in a small black area that I hadn't looked.  I texted them back that I had found it, and she even followed up with a call to make sure I had everything I needed and if I had any other questions.  I will definitely use them again!!

Title: THIS IS CHINESE CRAP THAT THEY SELL TO ALL  OUTLETS AND THEN DENY WARRANTY .
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
Body: I owned a pair of these chinese junk  purchased from amazon for about 2 months.  filled out the warranty info as required,  nothing was said or stated about any third party at any time.  at first, I could not get the phone switch to work, but I thought it was just my fingers, then about 2 weeks ago they just stopped working altogether  I contacted the manufacturer and gave them my info , and was told that a new set would be provided.  Since then I have lrecieved multiple calls asking for additional info, which was given.  Today I was told from customer service in Hong Kong, that because I had purchased the set from a third party, unknown by me, the warranty would not be honored.  there was no mention of a third party when I registered the item on the warranty forms, nor was that indicated during the warranty registration. THEY SUCK, TGR-Tech SUCKS, Amazon SUCKS, and CHINA SUCKS !!!

Title: Junk!!!!!!!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2024
Body: The first one I ordered lasted about 6 months until one of the earbuds quit working. I ordered a second time & the whole charger quit working after 1 month...then thinking it was just a fluke, I ordered another one & it's also completely dead after 1 month. Too many other brands to choose from. Won't make this mistake again....

Title: Will not hold a charge, battery will not last longer than 5 minutes
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2023
Body: Unusually, these headphones were fully charged from the minute I opened them. I used them for the first time on a 5 hour flight and they worked perfectly-- I could still hear the airplane noise a little, but it cut out the majority of outside sounds.The problems came after my trip, when I tried to put the earbuds to charge for my next flight. I put each earbud into the proper slot, and the case registered that they were charging. Great! But when I put them on the next day, I was disappointed to see that I could only use them for about 5 minutes before they disconnected themselves from my Bluetooth and died.Since that point, I have tried a million different ways to charge these stupid things. I've jiggled them to make sure that the contacts are connecting. I've tried the case both on and off the charger. I've cleaned the contacts (with a dry, clean cloth only!) on both the earbuds and the case. This product is clearly defective-- or perhaps was never intended to work for more than a single use. Save yourself the heartache and get a different brand of earbuds.

Title: Sound quality is TERRIBLE.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Body: The title about sums it up. I bought as a replacement for $15 Earcandy buds. These are twice as expensive and not even half as good sound quality.  I wasn't expecting anything amazing for the price, but should be at least as good as the bargain basement buds I was trying to replace.

Title: Will not connect to any phone after 2 months
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
Body: I bought these for someone else, they gave up on connecting them to their phone but waited until the return window had closed to let me know.  I also can not connect them to my phone, even though the case shows that they are charged.

Title: Disappointed ☹️
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
Body: I bought these with high hopes as I read many positive reviews on them. However, not only are these ear buds incredibly uncomfortable to wear, they don’t stay in my ears at all. They start slipping out of my ears every thirty seconds or so and I have to keep pushing them back into my ears, which ends up either pausing or skipping whatever song/video I’m listening to/watching and it’s really annoying. (It’s some sort of setting on them I can’t figure out how to turn off.) Also, the right ear bud is already crapping out, and I JUST got these less than a week ago. They’re loud though, I’ll give them that. Besides that however, these really aren’t that great. It’s better to spend more money on better wireless earbuds. I didn’t want to have to spend more money on another pair of Air pods (after my first pair finally stopped working after about two years, that’s why I tried these instead hoping they’d be better for a cheaper price), but that’s exactly what I’m gonna have to do. Oh well. 🤷‍♀️

Title: Not worth it
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2024
Body: They worked great when it did but buds kept falling out of my ears get over ear buds that go in the ear if u want to do anything but sit still, and they kept coming out when i was eating/chewing

Title: These do not work.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
Body: I have purchased these twice during approximately the last 3 years.  They always have worked just fine.  Recently  I lost the earbuds and so ordered a new set.  The fist set arrived earlier this month. Would not pair up no matter what I did.  Ordered another pair and received the next day. Right ear does not turn on at all; the left turned on but would not connect to my iPhone.  Two duds in a row. This one being returned too.

Title: Horrible and unreliable
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Body: These have been absolutely awful.  When I go more than 5 feet from my computer, they disconnect.  Even when I'm sitting in front of my computer they randomly disconnect or the audio cuts out.  Absolute garbage.

Title: Poor quality compared to others at this price
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
Body: I got these to see if the shape was better compared to in-ears without the bottom part that holds your ear. I can say these definitely stay in place well. I liked everything about them at first, but the audio quality and sound consistency (connecting to both buds at the same time) decreased so fast. Now they don’t always charge (you have to try to place the buds in the right place in the charging case multiple times to get them to charge, sometimes the right earbud is charged but the left is dead and won’t work). Overall not the worst but I have other pairs that lasted for years…I’m not overly hard on them either. Just disappointed.

Title: Meh
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2024
Body: Acceptable given how cheap these are...Mine lasted 2 years with mild use before the case/battery stopped accepting a charge.  Had some trouble switching between blue tooth devices and had clunky controls for volume skip etc but overall acceptable. I'm looking elsewhere for my next set

Title: Just okay
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
Body: I got these to replace some other buds I lost because the reviews looked promising. Well, they fall out of my ears a lot and the "button" on the bud to pause/play works when it wants to. I tap it several times and nothing happens, yet other times I barely brush against it and it pauses my music or video. The shape of the bud is awkward and I thought they would be a better pair since they were more expensive, but they really aren't. Not noise cancelling at all either, I can hear all the noises around me when I'm at the gym. Disappointed. The color is cute though, and they sound okay.

Title: The stop working in 3 months
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2024
Body: Comfortable.  Good sound quality.  Good controls.  After 3 months of use one side stopped charging, but because of the things listed above, I bought them again.  Same problem.  3 months in and the same side stopped functioning

Title: Quality
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2024
Body: Sometimes the quality would be great and other times it wouldn’t be great. I thought I found some good ones for a good price for my Apple iPhone after spending $200+ for air buds. But my search continues! They’re cool though

Title: Like these but……….
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2024
Body: I really like these ‘buds, but after just 7 months of use, they no longer hold a charge. I have probably charged every one to two weeks over that period, so this is pretty disappointing. Otherwise they have been very good.

Title: edited review
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
Body: Update: The company reached out to me and really worked to make this right.  My hope is that the pair I got was simply a fluke.  I certainly appreciate any company that listens to a customer's concerns and works with them to resolve the issue.I don't like writing negative reviews but really felt I needed to warn potential buyers.  From the moment I got these ear buds, they were glitchy. Since I got them on sale, I figured it's not too bad so I'll just keep them -- especially since I only use them 3x/week for working out.  Big mistake.  The gliches only got worst.  I often struggle to get them to connect properly with Bluetooth.  Then, when it is finally connected and playing, one or both will suddenly cut out. I have to stop my working out to tap at the ear buds, take them out, and/or have to take out my phone and restart the process of trying to connect.  I've only had them 2 months but that means I'm past the 1 month return window.  I'm trashing them and having to spend more money to buy better ear buds.  Don't waste your money like I did.

Title: Verdict is still out
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2024
Body: 1. Comfy for my ears2 cute charging box3. Easy to use to hook up to my iPhone.Complaint would be that it skips a lot with the one and off while listening to my music.

Title: Ok, wouldn't purchased if they had not been on sale.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2023
Body: I bought these primarily to wear when mowing and when sleeping.  Unfortunately they are borderline loud enough for mowing (battery powered mower) and too loud for sleeping.  I believe someone else mentioned the minimum volume being too loud as well.  The touch controls are inconsistent.  On a positive note they are very comfortable.UPDATE:  TAGRY people are reading these reviews!  I didn't ask for a refund but I received an email today from TAGRY offering a full refund.  I'm not sure I have ever received an unsolicited refund on Amazon before.  Since my initial review I have gotten a better impression of these headphones.  The issue with not being loud enough to hear over my electric lawnmower can be overcome by reseating the buds in my ears as I mow - not a big deal though it does sometimes pause the playback or lower/raise the volume.  I have a pretty bumpy yard and I think the vibration from mowing jars the buds just enough to make the sound almost unhearable.  As regards being too loud for sleep, I'm still working on that solution.  I have also come to appreciated the packaging and design of this product.  One change that would be helpful is for the lid of the holder to have a detent so that it will remain open until the user closes it.  The touch controls were too inconsistent to use anymore (except when I'm not trying to use them), so I just change the volume for the device they are paired with.  Note: I have been diabetic for over 30 years and the pin pricks to my fingers to check my blood sugar (scar tissue) may be the cause of the touch controls not working as well as they might for others.  I'd give these a solid 4 stars now.

Title: very disappointed
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2024
Body: I do not recommend these, they sound like you're listening through a barrel. I don't know how else to describe it, they are loud, have decent bass, but the overall sound is not good in my opinion.

Title: Not easy to pause and stop/answer disconnect
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
Body: These headphones are ok. For me it is hard to stop & start audio by using earpiece. Also, answering & disconnecting calls using earpiece was also difficult. Other than that, the sound quality is good.

Title: Disappointed in the battery life and no multipoint.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2024
Body: They are okay.  These are my first pair of wireless buds and expected the battery to last longer.  I listen to at work for pretty much 9 hours a day and they won't make it through the day without having to charge them at least once.  With degradation i expect they won't last more than a few months.  Was also disappointed to find out they don't support multipoint.  My bad as i expected in 2024 everything had this capability. Will be keeping them for maybe doing yardwork or something I don't need long battery life, but will be buying something else.

Title: Decent… but not great sound
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024
Body: Decent earbuds, but I personally wouldn’t buy them again. The near max volume gives a bad distortion. While using them for phone calls I have had people say It is hollow… and has an echo to them. One person stated it sounded like I was in a stairwell (which I wasn’t).They DO have a good battery life, and if you’re looking for something cheap that will get you by…. Go for it.

Title: Once charge gets below 86% the ear buds stop working well.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
Body: The ear buds are attractive, work well, have good enough sound quality on either end of the conversation, but have one fatal flaw, once the battery life gets to or below 86 percent they no longer connect well and sound on either end of the conversation, as if the user is at the end of a long tunnel. This is a bit disappointing and requires frequent re-charging to be able to hold phone conversations.

Title: Good for a while, but gave me headaches
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Body: I bought these over a year ago. They are decent basic earbuds. I'd never had wireless earbuds before and wanted to try them out. However, I have found that they've started to emit a soft, but high-pitched, electronic buzzing noise when I use them. They were also putting pressure on my inner ears, giving me headaches. I am now shopping for better quality earbuds.

Title: Mostly good.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2024
Body: I loved these headphones, they worked really well. Sound quality and noise canceling were great. But they didn't stay in my ears for long. They kept falling out. I was hoping to use them at the gym but I don't think I'll be able to since they won't stay in when I'm just sitting down. They could work for you though!

Title: Some problems, but Tagry Costumer Service take care... waiting for replacement
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
Body: September 13:I bought these headphones as a gift for my wife. Additionally, I bought some accessories, ear supports to avoid losses due to falls and a case that matches well with the color of the headphones. I put together a complete gift. I thought I had made a good purchase. My great disappointment and annoyance has been seeing how the headphone controls go crazy and the volume goes up and down at will. The touch controls to control the headphones do not work well. It's lucky if they activate the desired function. Don't even think it will control the volume. These headphones do what they want. The battery on the left hearing aid lasts less than half that of the right hearing aid. The headphones turn off when they still have 50 to 60% charge and do not work again until they are over 70-80% charge, and then repeat the same strange phenomenon. Avoid losing your money and investment. Or worse yet, give a gift that won't work. I will return these headphones.Update: September 15, 2023I contacted: Amazon Customer Service, who contacted the manufacturer. The attention was precise and brief. They identified the situation and Tagry almost immediately sent a replacement unit. Thank you so much.This is the type of support and attention that is expected. I congratulate the manufacturer for the excellent willingness to focus on the guarantee of its products. I'm waiting for the new headphones to try them out and see if they work correctly. At the moment a 10/10 to TAGRY and Amazon for the support provided.As soon as I try the new headphones I will gladly update and rerate this review. And I emphasize that no one has asked me to change anything, but if TAGRY deserves 5 stars, I will gladly give it to them.

Title: Great Value for the Price but not for me
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023
Body: I recently purchased the TAGRY Bluetooth Headphones, and I'm impressed with their performance. These headphones offer excellent sound quality for their price point. The bass is punchy, and the highs and mids are clear, making my music and podcasts sound fantastic.The Bluetooth connectivity is reliable, and the range is impressive. I can leave my phone in one room and still enjoy uninterrupted music in another. Pairing with my devices was a breeze, and the connection remains stable.Comfort-wise, these headphones are comfortable to wear for extended periods. The cushioning on the ear cups is soft, and they fit snugly without causing discomfort. I appreciate the adjustable headband, which allows for a customized fit.Battery life is solid. I can go a few days without needing to recharge, which is convenient. The built-in microphone works well for calls, and I appreciate the hands-free functionality.One minor drawback is the plastic construction, which feels a bit flimsy. However, considering the affordability, it's a minor trade-off.Overall, the TAGRY Bluetooth Headphones provide great value for their price. They deliver impressive sound quality, comfort, and connectivity, making them a solid choice for budget-conscious users.Pros:Impressive sound qualityReliable Bluetooth connectivityComfortable for extended useLong battery lifeAffordable priceCons:Plastic construction feels somewhat flimsyI would recommend these headphones to anyone looking for an affordable wireless headphone option without compromising on sound quality

Title: It’s ok
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
Body: The sound is good, clear and loud at maximum volume. However, the battery dies too easily in my opinion. I’m not sure it mine has a defect but literally with every 30 seconds that pass when the ear phones are in the case the battery life goes down by one.

Title: Alright
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
Body: These headphones are good for calls. I love music and am picky about the sound of headphones. The quality of these could be better for music, and I can find headphones around this price with better sound quality. Additionally, no matter which size buds I put on, they do not stay in my ears. The touch feature on the pods is annoying as any slight touch will pause the music. This can be frustrating as I have to adjust the earbuds often to stay on my ears, touching the reactive part. All in all, these are mediocre earbuds. They're okay. I can do with them if I'm in a pinch, but you can find better at TJ Maxx for less, I promise.

Title: Mixed feelings
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
Body: The sound is fine, BUTThere can be loud beeps when you first turn them on.  Highly annoying and probably dangerous.The controls are complicated.  Some are on the left ear, some are on the right.  Some things you tap once, other twice, others three time.  No real buttons do you don’t know if your taps are “registering.”The numbers on the meter which you see in the pictures are useless.  I think they you the strength of the battery pack, but you have no idea of the battery life of the earpieces.  So with a few minutes to go you get notified that the battery is low and then it’s silence.

Title: Doesn't pair consistently
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
Body: It's very hard to get these paired with any of my bluetooth devices.  Even if they pair once, despite the claim that repairing is automatic, they don't usually pair.  The materials say that when the lid is opened, they first pair with each other then pair with your device.  If I immediately take out one of the earbuds when I open the lid, the pairing lights blink for 1 or 2 seconds then go out and I haven't found a way to get the lights back on with the earbud out of the case.  I've tried every solution in the materials and nothing works so far.  If after opening I leave the lid open with the earbuds in their slots and next to my device sometimes after at least 10 seconds the earbuds will show up and I can pair.  I give up.

Title: DO NOT BUY: “Button” is impossible to work
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
Body: The Good news: they come charged and u take them out of the container & they paired with my phone.The Bad news: they wouldn’t pair with my tv: proby  bc I couldn’t manually get them into pairing mode. Each earbud has only one control “button” but it’s indented! So I tried pushing it with my fingernail & it’s nearly impossible to work. I gave up. You have to download a manual bc it comes with minimal directions. I can’t believe anyone can work these and I think the positive reviews must be fake! Don’t waste your energy and money!

Title: Sadly, crapped out after 4 months of use
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
Body: I purchased these earbuds to listen to my podcast while working around the house. They were not purchased with the idea I was getting high end noise canceling earbuds. Initially, they worked great and served it purpose, I was very satisfied with the quality and on a cost benefit basis had absolutely no compliant. I even recommended this product to friends & family.  Sadly, the product did not last. About 4 - 5 months in, the earbuds were not holding a charge despite the case showing 100% charge. If I do get them to work, it's usually short lived, meaning minutes. Now, I do understand you get what you pay, I did not expect them to compete with my higher end earbuds but since I was pleasantly surprised initially not only with the voice sounds but even with music, it was very disappointing to have them crap out on me in such a short amount of time. I do have to check if they come with any warranty.

Title: READ UPDATE BEFORE PURCHASE
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2023
Body: I am amazed at these. First of all, for those looking for iPod pro dupe… here it is. Very similar in appearance. Secondly, the price was fantastic. I got these for twenty bucks. They are great for everyday use. They stay in ear nicely and have decent sound considering these are nose Bose quality buds. I listen to music all the time and am very pleased. The noise cancellation is definitely not comparable to actual AirPod pros not even close but $20 vs. $200+ makes these a keeper. I love these. The battery life is great. The range is good but since I keep my case in pocket/bag on me at all times this isn’t an issue. I use one in ear to exchange when needed and blithe buds and the battery case hold a good charge. Definitely provides all day constant use if not using as a pair. The are also water resistant to some degree. I dropped them in the tub for 3-5 seconds and haven’t had any issues. For twenty bucks you can’t go wrong.UPDATE:  The charging case quit lighting up 63 days after purchase. Really stinks it’s outside return window. I did drop one bud in The tub and it continued to work but the charging case went out for no apparent reason as it hasn’t been near the tub lol. So I no longer recommend this product.  What a shame

Title: Want to like these but..uugghh
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2023
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
                



I like the sound that I receive from these but there are a few problems. Based on the video (both sets are in their cases), for some reason one charges but not the other one in the set. And its not a case issue because I've switched earbuds to that case and then that earpiece will charge. I have to keep taking it out and putting it back in for it to work. I have 2 and they often randomly just switch to the other set even though it will be in its case.  So I'm always scrambling during calls or media play to disconnect the one that's connecting even though I'm not using it. They're constantly falling out of my ears have no noise canceling feature because people complain about the background sounds. It will randomly just turn all the way up and say "maximum volume" and wont allow me to adjust it. I have to put them in the case then take them out again for this to stop. And finally, the slighest brush against it will stop the playback at times but then other times when I'm trying to stop/pause - it either won't or it'll advance to the next song. So I guess you get what you pay for. Back to Apple airpods. Sigh.

Title: Don’t trust the positive reviews at all
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
Body: Everyone says how comfortable they are, how amazing the sound is, and how amazing they are for the price. I believed the positive reviews and I wish I didn’t. In my eyes I was scammed. First of all the sound isn’t “good for the price” it’s a little less than what you should expect. It’s not bad but for how much they cost it should be better. But my biggest issue is that the left and right earbud don’t stop making static and clicking noises. It’s hard to drown them out even with music playing. I’m not the only one with this issue either. For some reason this company loves to send customers what I would consider faulty earbuds

Title: Mediocrity
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2024
Body: Pros: it produces soundCons: 1. even on minimal volume these are too loud2. Sound stage is practically non-existent3. I should've caught it sooner, but touch control scheme is idiotic - it uses "undefined" longevity presses that  often interfere with each others (volume up/down and turn off for example)4. There is practically no trebles and the bass is muddy at best.

Title: Nope
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2024
Body: Listened to it maybe 10 mins and threw them back in the box. Most people say sound is OK or mediocre at best. Literally at $12 pair of skullcandy headphones from Ross sounds way clearer than these. Not impressed with sound quality or the echoing while listening to music. ...  not clear, volume is great but just isn't for me.

Title: Don’t waste your time
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2024
Body: These worked for me twice and now the refused to connect to any of my devices no matter what method I use. I will be contacting Amazon and expect a full refund.Also, no matter which size ear grip is used, they do not stay in my ears. Apple is far superior. Pay extra for Apple to get a better product.

Title: Multiple Issues - Sensitive Ears Beware
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
Body: I normally don’t write reviews, but given the overwhelming positive ratings, I’m surprised and disappointed by this product. Plus I wanted to warn others with medical conditions like migraines or sensitive ears that these may exacerbate.First off, these ear buds are pulsatingly LOUD, particularly for bass even on my iPhone’s reduce bass setting or lowering the volume. It’s so bad it makes the inside of my ears tingle and sets my teeth on edge— maybe I’m hypersensitive as a migraine sufferer but using them for more than a few seconds is a physically uncomfortable to nauseating experience. Anyone with inner ear sensitivities may want to reconsider purchasing. I’ve tried all EQ combos including turning off EQ and toggling the balance between the headphones and nothing works.Secondly, they are uncomfortable. I have small ears and while they come with multiple ear pieces I seem to have gotten two mediums and one large set.Thirdly, I cannot get them to connect with calls— only music. I’ve tried the troubleshooting directions in the user manual but no luck.Will be returning if possible.

Title: Company who stands behind their product.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2024
Body: The product is exceptional for the value.  I've had the earbuds for quite some time and the left earbud suddenly stopped working.  I contacted Tagry, the seller, they honored my warranty and replaced it with a new set without any problem.  They called me and we did attempt to troubleshoot the problem but without hesitation, they sent me a new set.  They followed up to ensure I received them and that they were in good working condition.  Great company who stands behind their product.

Title: Modern and easy to use
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
Body: There is almost nothing wrong with this. I bought this and was a little skeptical because of how cheap it was. It was the exact product in the photos and I’ve never felt so good spending my money. The earbuds are very lightweight and they fit perfectly into my ear. The battery life can sometimes last me 5 days. Worth buying! :D

Title: 100% as advertised
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2024
Body: This ear bud is used so I can listen to football, news, or whatever while my wife entertains herself in the same room. I use only one because I’m deaf in one ear. By the way, they won’t work as a hearing aid. This is a wonderful cost/benefit value for private listening. I even activated and paired the buds on the first attempt. You would be more impressed by that last statement if you knew what a techno klutz I am.

Title: great deal at a great price!!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2024
Body: I am not picky, nor do I need the big name brands. So this product was something I took a shot at. And....I was glad I did. They fit my ears great and are easy to use. The sound is very good and they keep a nice charge (the longest I have used them is 4 hours at once).

Title: Sound and fit a great quality for the price.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
Body: I’m not an expert on ear pods or anything speaker related but I like music and prefer it to be clear but I’m not one to spend over $100 on ear pods despite me having a particular brand watch and phone so I decided to take a chance on something cute and a decent price and I’m not disappointed at all. I only received them yesterday and I just sat in bed for about half an hour and played around with them, I thought the sound was great and they seemed to fit without sliding out and they were pretty comfortable for someone who doesn’t really like things in my ears or around my face. Hopefully they last but according to reviews the customer service is excellent should there be any issues so I’d say even if you owned a more expensive pair these are a great extra pair for going somewhere you may be more likely to lose them it was less then $30 ..

Title: Really like these headphones
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2024
Body: I use one pod at a time and the battery last so long I work overnight and I can get one to last the whole night and then switch them the next night. And I can go 2/3 days in between charging the actual case!!!

Title: Charge Lasts for a Long Time
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2024
Body: My wife lost her Apple Air Pods, and I ordered these for her. The color selection was good, and she likes the lavender case. The Apple Pods fit poorly in her ears, and these actually fit better. The sound quality is good. And the best thing about these is the extended battery life. The price was a fraction of the cost of Apple Air Pods. Pairing the pods with her iPhone was easy.

Title: Apple who?
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Body: These are great, amazing noise cancelling ability. I got these because I’m afraid to spend the money on Apple AirPods since I lose things easily. But I’ve had these for a long time and they hold charge extremely well, good with music and calls.

Title: Great!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2024
Body: Best I've tried next to airpods ofcourse. But if you dint want to spend the money or you lost your airpods go with these!! They're very comfortable in the ear unlike most earbuds and the sound is above average!! Great buy for the $!

Title: Great headphones
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2024
Body: These replaced my stepson’s old headphone and He was very happy with them. They automatically connect to his phone as soon as he took them out of the case. The quality of sound on videos is good. Battery life is good as well.

Title: NOT for sensitive ears!!!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2023
Body: I bought these to replace my Galaxy Buds pro because over time I had an allergic reaction to the nickel used in their product. I was so badly hoping I wouldn't have that issue with these. I was so wrong. I chose these due to the digital battery indicator and color and the reviews seemed good. I couldn't for the life of me find a list of what materials were used but I got them anyway. When I first got them, they had a strong chemical smell of burning plastic, which worried me but I have been dying for a pair of headphones, especially for the gym and ones that won't break the bank if I don't like them. Putting them in, they're snug, and the sound is good for what you pay for, but vocals sound kind of muffled. I used them after testing on a call with my boyfriend, sounds is pretty good, he even said my voice was pretty clear. But after maybe a couple of hours with the headphones in, I could feel my ears starting to get irritated like they would with the allergic reaction I was having with the Galaxy earbuds. After I ended the call, my ears felt worse so I took them out and all night they were itching, burning, bleeding, and leaking fluid, some yellow, clear, or green. I had to stuff my ears with tissues to get it to calm down. It's now been a week and I've only worn them the day I got them and am trying to let my ears heal. I don't think it's a good idea to try again even if I switch out the ear tips. I'm really sad they broke me out so bad but if you don't have an allergy to any type of material, you might like them.

Title: Not great
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2022
Body: I ordered these ear buds because the reviews were all pretty good, but these headphones suck. Idk what everyone was talking about when they “loved” these. They’re not noise cancelling AT ALL. I can literally hear everything with the headphones in,  and on full blast volume. The amount of audio you can hear coming from the headphones when you don’t have them in is like jarring. It’s ridiculous. My ears are really small so I have a hard time finding ear buds that’ll fit my ears, and so I usually buy earbuds with the rubber tips because those always fit my ears so well, I bought these earbuds specifically because of the rubber tips and these will not fit in my ears at all, way too big. And they don’t even provide a smaller fitting ear bud to switch to, all just just bigger size options . And, this last one could just be me, I’ve never had “touch compatible” ear buds but they’re very annoying. The slightest handing of the headphone causes the song to pause on and off, and the audio is always blasting because I can’t hear anything on such a low volume on these things. I bought these in the hopes they’d be a cheaper alternative to skull candies…never again. I’ll just stick to what I know works for me. So annoyed. So do not but these if:-you enjoy noise canceling headphones/ear buds-you have trouble getting air pods to stay in your ear..there’s no way you’ll get these to stay in there .-you like privacy when you’re listening to whatever you’re listening to. Because these headphones/ear buds, you can literally hear everything coming from them when you don’t have them on.Gonna try to see if my fiancé will want to use these cause he doesn’t really care as much as I do, but I will for sure not be using these at all. Just gonna buy some skull candies. What a waste. This is why I hate taking a risk and buying things like this on Amazon, it’s always a miss for me.

Title: Annoying to Use UPDATE: broke after 32 days
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2023
Body: I love the look of these earbuds but practically they're really annoying to use. A couple of issues:1- The functionality for skipping, replaying, and turning volume up and down isn't found in a single earbud. When I'm working out or biking I like to only have one earbud in so I can still hear what's going on around me. The right one skips songs and turns volume up, the left one replays and turns volume down, which means unless you're wearing both you don't get the full functionality. My previous wireless earbuds didn't require you to wear both to have full functionality.2- They don't fit well, they're constantly sliding out of my ear, which wouldn't be a big problem except for the next issue.3- They have weird sensitivity to touch. Every time I adjust them in my ear it ends up pausing, no matter how careful I am to only try to grab the stem. On the flip side, when I try to skip songs by tapping the right ear it usually ends up pausing the song. I tested this morning and it takes me, on average, 3 attempts to skip a song.From the pro side, the sound is good, the battery life is great so far, and I love that the case tells you your remaining battery power so I'm not charging the case unnecessarily.UPDATE: on day 32 (convenient 30-day return policy) these broke. They won't hold a charge and just drain the case down to zero. They also make a bizarre buzzing noise and even though my phone says they're connected I can't get any sound and my apps all show a playback error and refuse to play while they're connected.

Title: Dealbreaker
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2022
Body: ***UPDATE BELOW*** I am super bummed. The reviews for this product were great and I really wanted to give this product a good rating but I ran into issues that made doing so impossible. Usually, the rubber earbuds come in small, medium, and large size options. Mine only had two pairs of the same size and one larger. Both options are way too large for my ears so the pieces do not rest comfortably or securely. I have never run into a problem like this with similar products and usually use the medium size.The biggest problem, and the DEALBREAKER, is that when I  went to recharge the earphones and the case for the second time... it did not work. I made sure that I used the cord it came with. I made sure the issue was not with the cord itself and that the cord was capable of powering my other electronics. The cord itself worked fine. I'm very disappointed. I will be returning the product shortly. I will get a new set and see if I run into the same problem again. I will update this post afterward.THE PROS: I was very impressed by the sound and the touch-sensitive "buttons" that worked very well. If the product was capable of recharging, as it should be, I would have kept it despite not being the most comfortable or secure (due to just how well the sound and buttons/sensors worked).  I have used these many times throughout the past week since I received them. I have had no interference issues and have found that I am able to walk more than 30 feet with no issues of cutting out.UPDATE: I received my replacement order. The earphones work great (as did the previous pair). However, this one is able to hold a charge. Unfortunately, the case will only charge up to 24 percent. I bought one for my son and his has always worked wonderfully. He has never had a problem with charging.

Title: DO NOT BUY THESE BUDS! Awful everything
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2024
Body: Just spend $20-30 more and get name brand buds. You won’t be excited to use these. They’re insulting. the touch controls on the earbuds work about 1/2 the time - they mostly activate when you're trying to get them in and out of your ears. For some reason the battery % has been quickly plummeting since i opened these? its been about and hour since i opened them, i listened to music for 10 minutes max, and the battery is at 83% ? The sound quality isn't TERRIBLE, but its definitely not "good." about what you'd expect for this price range. these are cheap trash - returning immediately. Got some JBLs for $50 and I’m VERY pleased with them.

Title: Not for Exercising.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
Body: Got these about 3 weeks ago. In that time, I have come to regret buying these earbuds.Pros:1) Battery Life - No problem. Can last several days.2) Waterproof - No problem. Have sweated and worked out with these, no noticeable damage.3) Connectivity - No problem. Can connect to phone relatively easily.Cons:1) Sound Quality - Annoying but can be adjusted to. Sounds weird and slightly muffled. If you want these, don't be buying them for the sound quality.2) Touch Control - Horrible. It is extremely inconsistent. Sometimes it will be super sensitive to the point where you can brush your finger across the pad (the most easily touched part) while readjusting the earbud and it pauses whatever is being played. Other times you can press on the earbud multiple times at various strengths and directions and it does not recognize the touch. I like to use earbuds to listen to music when working out. I have to regularly readjust these when they get dislodged by sweat, making it easy for me to accidentally touch the earbud control area and stop my music... While others may prefer such touch control, sadly this is not for me.

Title: Wanted to like these. But still ended up faulting in 1 day and failing in 5.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2023
Body: The earbuds themselves are pretty decent for the price. Mediocre battery life (~3hrs), decent sound quality -- but thats where it stops.These being wireless we can all obviously expect we need to charge them. Thats where we're going to have a bad time.The case itself is nice. Gives you a decent percentage counter on the cases remaining battery, indicators that the earbuds are charging ... well sort of. They'll slowly animate a charging battery, but at this rate I think they're just indicating that they're ticking down to a potential lithium fire.Want to charge both? Fine, just open and close the lid a couple times every 30mins.Want to charge both AND the case? Nope. It'll just charge the earbud that is at 100%. Forget the one that is out of a charge because it decided not to charge that anyways. It'll charge the case though.When you're done dealing with the crappy touch controls and quirky charging case and attempt to goto the manual and attempt to troubleshoot it - you're just faced with generic information. FAQ? F🤡🤡🤡 Answering Questions is what that part stands for. Oh well, the paper instructions are bad. What about their support site? Two different numbers, two different email addresses. Who made this site and how many bottles of isopropyl did they consume to make it? What a mess! Just like the product.I sure hope no one brings these onto a plane.

Title: Stopped working in less than 2 months.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2024
Body: I bought these earbuds and thought they were great. The sound was great, the connections were flawless, and I don't even know if they were noise cancelling but they sure seemed to work as well as my Bose over the ear headphones. But, suddenly they just disappeared out of my list of available devices on my iPhone, iPad, Dell computer, and HP computer and are unable to be discovered or reconnected. I tried calling the help line but of course it just wanted me to leave a message.... with my email? How they would be able to help me via email is unknown. I guess I'm lucky they were cheap.

Title: "Undocumented" issue.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
                



Bought these earbuds back in early July 2023 knowing its possible limitations based purely on the price. Up until a month ago I was perfectly happy with them; one good day I unplugged it after charging (always to 100%) and the screen just started flashing 0, then stopped after a few seconds. I could use the earbuds up until last week, when they would no longer charge (the case was totally out of charge). when I plug it or open the case, all I get is a flashing 0, and it does not charge. I have tried researching online, but I can't find anything on this issue.

Title: Nope. Get the X18 pair instead.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
Body: I decided sometime ago that my teenage sons are just going to lose earbuds, a lot, so rather than buy expensive pairs like I did with the Beats, I am going to buy several inexpensive pairs. Not by design, but by necessity, I know a bit about that which I speak. I will not, however, buy these again. Please see below.First the good: they look exactly like they are pictured. They display the charging percentage the on front.But many of these headphones do that, and these are not the best selection.So what do you want? Well, they should fit well, and they should sound good: these do neither.The same manufacturer makes the X18 earbuds, and I have ordered two pair of them because they look good and they sound good and they fit well unlike these. They also display the charging percentage on the front.

Title: Great Headphones, but Very Loud
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
Body: Overall, these earbuds are pretty nice! They were easy to pair to my phone and stay paired, but one unfortunate downside is that they don't automatically disconnect when you put the earbuds in the case, so in order to play anything out of the phone's speaker, you have to turn your bluetooth off or unpair from the earbuds.My biggest complaint is that even on the lowest setting, they are quite loud. On iPhone, you can manually move the volume bar to between mute and the first "notch" of volume (one click up on the volume) in order to get the quietest sound possible, but these headphones don't accommodate that, and just mute when you try to move the volume any lower than the first notch. That being said, the sound didn't bleed, and the quality seemed decent.I didn't find them the most comfortable, but I am also super picky about that, so they should be relatively fine to wear for an hour or two for most people. They have a very long battery life, and the case hasn't dropped below 95% charge in 3 days of use.Lastly, the "one touch to pause/play" feature is super finnicky. Whenever I'm adjusting the earbuds in my ear, I always accidentally seem to pause, and when I'm *trying* to pause, it never seems to work! Very frustrating.Overall, besides little issues and the volume, these are nice earbuds, and are exceptionally nice for the price! Would recommend, even though I am going to go for a different option (I'm very sensitive to sound).

Title: Kinda disappointing
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2024
Body: These buds aren't bad, per se, but there's one thing that I expected them to be able to do and yet it seems that they don't: allow me to use one ear bud without draining the power of the other bud.  I usually like to use a single earbud, mostly so that I can hear whatever else is going on around me and so that I can essentially double the battery life of the buds by using one and then switching to the other when that first one starts to run out of power.  I thought these ones allowed that, and I could swear that I was able to do that once or twice, but most of the time, it seems that when I open the charger and pull one bud out, the other one remains on, draining its battery.  So, while these aren't bad, and they sound pretty decent, I am rather disappointed that they bud that remains in the charger doesn't turn off.  Not sure why that would be a special feature.  Seems like something most buds should do, but maybe I'm wrong.

Title: Purchased, Delivered & Returned all Within 2 Weeks (NOT GREAT)
Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
Body: I had high hopes for these earbuds. I read the reviews (always the Most Recent first) and I found many more positive/high-rating reviews than negative/low-rating reviews. After comparing it with other similar products, I decided on the TAGRY X08 Bluetooth Headphones Ture Wireless Earbuds 60H Playback LED Power Display Earphones with Wireless Charging Case IPX5 Waterproof in-Ear Earbuds with Mic for TV Smart Phone Computer Laptop Sports (wow-quite a mouthful for a name). I was excited and hopeful when I hit the "Place Your Order" Button. After a quick delivery (PRO), I was soon disappointed with the product.My first major complaint was comfort. I may have smaller than normal ear canals because even with the use of the smallest size ear tips included in the package, I found it difficult to have the earbuds in for long without my ears becoming uncomfortable. When I would wear them, the earbuds would only be in my ears for 30 minutes before I was constantly needing to readjust them to find an angle that was comfortable. The "Products Description" and "Features & Details" state that the earbuds can be worn comfortably while driving, relaxing, working, or even sleeping. I would NEVER wear these earbuds during ANY of those chill activities.
