The TAGRY X08 hurt too badly for me to get comfortable enough to relax or do any of those things.The MAIN reason I chose to purchase these earbuds over any others was the COMFORT rating given by Amazon Reviewers. The TAGRY X08 was given an average rating of 4.9🌟 out of 5 for COMFORT. I'm baffled that these earbuds would receive such a favorable rating in this category and would personally score it a 2.5🌟My other major complaint was the "Smart Touch Control". I have relatively small fingers, which usually allows me to be able to manipulate and access small areas on phones, earbuds, headphones, or other similar products. I had no such luck with the TAGRY X08. When listening to music or a podcast, it was difficult for me to get the timing down for the earbuds to distinguish the difference between "PLAY/PAUSE" (one tap) and "NEXT/PREVIOUS TRACK" (two taps). Even when I would remove an earbud from my ear, it was still difficult for me to use so I would end up using my phone to skip or pause the song or show.There were a few positive aspects to the TAGRY X08. The earbuds would charge up to 100% pretty quickly after being placed in the case to charge. However, I did notice that the earbuds would run out of juice WAY FASTER than others I've had in the past. As long as I remembered to keep the charging case with me at all times, I would be able to charge the earbuds after the 4/4.5 hours of use. But if I were to leave the house without the charging case (which, unfortunately, did happen a few times) and be gone for 7-9 hours, I would find myself without the use of the earbuds for 5+ hours.The "One-Step Auto Pairing" was SUPER convenient and made me very happy each time I would open the case to have the earbuds always connect to my phone. I also enjoyed the light weight of the case and found it easy to hold in my pocket without much thought to it otherwise.Overall, the negatives outweighed the positives for me which is why I returned the TAGRY X08 Earbuds. Thankfully, I selected to have the charge added to my Amazon balance so it was a quick process (PRO).

Title: Automatically Plays
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
Body: The sounds quality is fine, they look nice, I really like the display on the front with the battery life.But, they automatically play whatever you were last listening to/watching when you put them in. The tap play/pause function is incredibly sensitive and can be touched by mistake very frequently.So when you take the earbud out of the case, if you aren't extremely careful with how you handle them, they'll automatically start playing whatever you were last listening to. which doesn't seem all that bad, unless your volume was on high the last time you played something and it begins blasting in your ear.The tap function is so sensitive that I have hung up on calls while putting the second one in, for example.Every time I even touch one earbud, for any reason, I have to pause something on my phone.I just wish I could turn the tap feature off, and then they'd be perfect, but I've dug through all possible settings and it doesn't seem possible.

Title: Charging issues
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2024
Body: I really like the sound of these and how they fit. I have small ears so finding earbuds is sometimes a challenge. Like these. This is my second pair. With that being said I prob won’t buy them again. My first pair I got and same thing. Loved them but after about 5-6 months they wouldn’t charge the right bud. I tried to carefully clean the inside of the case, bottom of the bud and it wouldn’t charge. So I chocked it up to a $30 bud and bought a new pair. Same thing. 5-6 months later it stopped charging the left side. So now I have two cases to charge one pair. So it’s just sort of frustrating and I hate clutter so my drawer just feels cluttered having 2 cases chillin out in there.

Title: Great but connectivity issues
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2024
Body: None of the reviews that I’ve seen seem to really mention this. I tested these while running today. If I keep my phone in my pocket, the music starts cutting out a little bit here and there. It’s fine if my phone isn’t in my pocket… but music cuts out quite a bit at times when my phone is in my pocket. Very annoying and it’s a dealbreaker for me as I always keep things in my pocket. Otherwise, they sound great. I’m going to return these unfortunately.Update: I went for a walk and didn’t notice as much of it cutting out… almost none at all. I feel like it was worse during the run, possibly because many other people were around? Not sure, but still a dealbreaker.

Title: Good but not great
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2023
Body: Bought these Bluetooth earbuds as well as a pair of Tozo NC2 earbuds. These fit my small ears better (closer to that of Apple AirPod Pros) but my habit of only wearing one earbud at a time isn’t great. These earbuds are not single user friendly because the right earbud won’t function as a single…tapping doesn’t answer calls nor will it function as a play button, however it will pause the music/audiobook. I tend to use only one earbud at a time because of my constant book listening habit when completing mind numbing tasks around the house. I like to always keep one ear vacant for hearing other sounds around me and being able to switch to the other earbud when the 1st one’s battery dies. It’s equally important for me to be able to pause and restart what I’ve been listening to if someone speaks to me or something needs my full attention since I don’t always have a pocket to put my phone in. These don’t allow me to restart listening to my book/music once they’re paused using the right earbud. The left will work fine for this purpose so I’m not sure if I have a faulty set or if they all do this. The sound quality is great but the pass through of ambient sounds around me are more of an annoying whooshing/static noise on top of my music. I prefer to use the noise cancellation feature for that reason. Phone conversations are great using these earbuds and my husband says that it’s easier to hear me using these than my AirPods because these don’t amplify all the sounds around me to hear splitting noise (turning on a water faucet doesn’t drown out my voice nor does the click of my knife on my cutting board). Would I buy these again…possibly but there are so many to choose from in this price range, I’d probably give a different brand a try first.Edit: seller contacted me to assist me with the problems described above and couldn’t resolve the issues. I received another set of earbuds from them free of charge and this pair will function as a pair or single earbud for pause/play of audio listening but will not answer phone calls. The only way I can take calls on the second pair is to answer the call using my phone and switch from phone to the earbuds. I have also discovered that despite removing the earbuds from my ears they do not have the pause detection of Apple that will automatically pause listening when removed. These will continue playing audio until both earbuds are placed into the charging case. This is not a deal breaker but definitely an annoyance if I pause audio, remove them from my ears and inadvertently touch the earbuds and restart audio while handling them (quite easy to do). I am very pleased with this seller and their response to my difficulties with the purchase, but I’m not really impressed with the earbuds. I do continue to use them since I can get around the problems and I hate to toss out a great fitting earbud.

Title: Works great, but only with my phone
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2024
Body: I got these because my Apple air buds were dying..not working as great anymore with phone calls and I didn’t want to spend the $$ right now. They work clearly for phone calls and listen to music from my phone. The case feels cheap, but that doesn’t matter so much..but my watch and iPad won’t connect..I can even get it discoverable on my other devices. My only other complaint is getting used to the fact that if I take them out of my ears, the music/audio doesn’t stop and the button to answer calls doesn’t work. You get what you pay for and I’ll probably go back to a pricier option, but for now they work for hands free phone calls!

Title: Not for me
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2024
Body: I tried the various sizes of the rubber ends that go into the ear, and unfortunately none sealed as well as my old ones.  This being the case, there is a fair amount external noise leakage.  The end that goes into the ear is actually oblong instead of round, so perhaps that is why they don't seal very well. There is also some discomfort after having them in for a while.  Regarding the sound quality, they are a bit too mid-range/boxy sounding.  If sound quality, comfort, and/or noise cancellation are important to you, then I would suggest you look elsewhere and be prepared to pay a bit more....you get what you pay for I suppose.

Title: You get what you pay for
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024
Body: I purchased these to replace my Apple iPods because these were inexpensive and had rubber tips-which I was hoping would be more comfortable. But I did get what I paid for. The sound quality is not too bad, but the headphones fall out of my ears whenever I bend or lean over--and sometimes even when I'm not bending. And if I accidentally bump them--even lightly, the music pauses--which is annoying because it happens a lot. They will also continue to play when I take them out--they don't automatically stop. So, if you aren't too bothered by that kind of thing, then these are fine. But if you have the $$ to spend on something nicer--then do it.

Title: Great product
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2024
Body: First pair of completely wireless earbuds. I was reluctant- comfort and afraid they’d fall out. They are completely comfortable and stay put! The charge on the case lasts exceptionally long! The sound is excellent- while they are not 100% noise canceling, they have clear and strong volume that does the trick. I am going to purchase a set for my husband. Great value!

Title: Great value for both phone calls and music
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2023
Body: Sometimes I'm amazed by the advancements in wireless and micro technology, especially when it comes to audio. These popped up in an email from Amazon a few days ago. Though I usually ignore those Deal notices this one intrigued me. I have a JBL Everest over-ear headset that I love for indoor phone calls and they're pretty good for music too (though I don't use them that way). I often like to go outside when I'm on the phone and the JBLs aren't convenient to use with a stocking cap, so I'd thought briefly about getting something in-ear to wear under my hat. These were $35 and the reviews were good. I liked that the case wirelessly charges the ear buds, and the case can be charged wirelessly too. My Samsung phone has wireless charging so I already have two wireless chargers and they're very convenient (especially given that the USB port on my phone was getting sketchy). So I figured I'd give them a try. I played a variety of my favorite music. I first asked for Jeff Buckley live music and the first song that started playing as I stepped outside was "Hallelujah." I walked around the property listening to my favorite music and before I knew it I had been listening to music for about three hours. I had really only cared about the sound quality for phone calls and whether they would stay in my ears (which is usually a problem for me). They never came close to falling out and they are comfortable. For phone calls the sound quality is very good on both ends. And though they're rated as having a 33' range I walked all around the house and got considerably farther than that from my phone with two walls separating the devices and I had no dropouts. Overall I am so happy with them that after a week of using them I ordered a backup pair.I have three VERY minor niggles but even combined I wouldn't consider them significant enough to knock off even ½ star. First, I had trouble gripping them well enough to get them out of the case quickly when I got an unexpected phone call. I started leaving them on a paper towel on the table next to me, but it now seems I've discovered the right way to grip them. Second, though they have a voice announcement of which side is which when first removed from the case, I was concerned that I might confuse L and R as they don't appear to have any visible indicators. My solution was to use my fine-point permanent marker to write an L on the left one. Third, one of my wireless phone chargers is a tilted stand that holds my phone at a convenient angle. I was unable to get the Ear buds case to wirelessly charge on that one until last night when I accidentally discovered that the problem was that the case was too small to hit the sweet spot on the charger. I solved the problem by boosting the case up with a pad of mini sticky notes (as shown in the photo).EDIT (I apologize if I forget to come back to delete my previous review):None of the above has changed but I forgot to mention that these are NOT good for noise isolation (at least not the way they fit me) but I prefer it that way. I'm a musician and music sounds less natural to me when the surrounding environment is completely eliminated, and I like being able to have a conversation or hear a knock at the door without removing them. Even without a tight seal I never have to reseat them and the sound quality stays consistent (a first for me after trying several other brands).UPDATE: I've been using these ear buds for five weeks now. I use them for hours every day and they continue to impress me. On three occasions only the right channel had a signal when I initially put them in to listen to music, but each time I put them back in the case and took them out again (which turned them off and on) and they worked normally. I've only had this happen with music and only when I first take them out of the case (i.e. it hasn't happened while on a call or after I've been listening to music with both working).

Title: Amazing buds/price/service... buy these!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
Body: Yes, my subject line sounds like that trash hyperbole you get on annoying pop-up ads on your Smartphone! And ironically, it usually has to do with ear buds. There are tons of them on the market, and everyone claims to be the best.Now, first off, I am just a customer… never got any gifts or money or anything from this company, nor was asked to “click on a review” for a discount or whatever. No… the reason for all this hallelujah chorus, is that I’m really totally both jazzed, and a bit in awe of these earbuds. I think the main mind-blowing thing about them is the price. I mean, I have a bit of experience and knowledge with this kind of technology, and frankly, these days, what “guts” that are needed to be used to create Bluetooth ear buds is not that complex… nor expensive. How company’s like Sony, Apple, Bose, etc. can charge upwards of $300 for these boarders on theft and fraud!I’ve tried those “Rolls Royce” buds, and I urge you to do the same, and then try these Tagry Bluetooth Wireless Earbuds that are literally 90% less expensive. Yes, they retail for about $35! They come in an excellent quality charge base, are extremely easy to put on, (and have three extra size buds to give you a custom fit), and most important, their sound quality, and I mean crisp highs, solid middles, and bone- rumbling base, are outstanding. I cannot understand what more you would want either using them for talk radio, podcasts, YouTube, streaming movies, or TV, or playing your Amazon Music or Spotify or iTunes playlists. And yes, if connected to your iPhone, you can make and receive calls, and the microphone in the buds are top quality.Their Bluetooth software is flawless, connecting to your iPhone, or other Bluetooth devices effortlessly. They come with a pleasant woman’s voice letting you know various messages, like which earbud is in what ear, if they are connected or turned off, your volume control (including excess volume warning), etc.I’ve had these for several months, and have found the charging, which has a bright LED display and shows the individual charging of each bud, along with their percentage easy to read.And a note on their service. I’ve heard horror stories of folks trying to reach the outrageously over-priced other earbud company’s for tech support, or refunds, exchanges, etc. Basically it’s nonexistent, and when you do miraculously find a phone number to call them, and get someone on the line, you have to go to the UN to find an interpreter of rare third-world languages to understand what they are saying, and they seem to be trained, not on anything to do with the product, but to make the call as useless and confusing as possible, so that you will just give up and throw their buds, and your money in the trash.Now, I did have an initial problem, after a few months, in that the base charger seemed to be slowing a bit. Tagry gives you a LIFETIME WARRANTY… yes, an actually lifetime warranty, not one of those sham “lifetime warranties”, that corrupt company’s like Hammacher Schlemmer  have.I had enrolled with Tagry, on their website, to activate my warranty as soon as I received the buds. I called Tagry when I was seeing what could be a glitch in their charging base, and yes, unlike most other companies who hide their contact numbers as if they were nuclear codes, Tagry’s support phone number is plainly printed on their manual, and to my astonishment, I immediately was connected to a good ‘ol American customer service person, who actually worked for the company, spoke English, and made me feel as if I was a long-ago trusted friend. They truly cared, and said they were sorry, and that there was no need to troubleshoot the base, or return it, instead, they would process an order to send me a new one.A day later, they actually called me back to let me know that the replacement had been shipped, and that I should have it in a day or so, and if not, to please call them back right away. And yes, to apologize again for any inconvenience.  The replacement arrived the very next day. And again, their warranty is indeed for a lifetime, a no questions asked replacement policy. This is how much they believe in their product, and respect their customers.So, yes. It is insane to pay more than $35 for quality Bluetooth earbuds. Last year, I sent about a dozen of these out to friends and employees, to use for personal use, and for all that Zooming going on… and they love them. And none of had any problems.I’m sure you have had a plethora of bad experiences in the past few years, what with isolation, and way too much ordering on-line, finding the products you buy to be substandard, and customer service virtually non-existent. And that is why I’ve spend all this time expounding on the greatest of my earbuds. Yes, I have a life. Really. But what a joy to be able to tell a story like this, rather than the kind of frustration most of us are experiencing every day!Yes, goodness and quality still exist. It’s rare… but it’s out there!

Title: Long lasting earbuds
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
Body: Didn't want to spend a bunch of money on apple airpods so I bought these as an alternative. The sound is great and they stay in my ears. I took them traveling with me and I've never had them fall out and it's been months now. The battery life lasts a long time and the case tells you how much battery is left. Easy to connect to any of my devices too I've never had an issue. The rose gold color is also super cute too I got compliments on it

Title: Perfect …The best earphone I purchased
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
Body: I keep losing my Apple earphones so I gave up buying them and tried this one ,but before coming to this I Ofcourse tried other brands,everything else I tried was garbage…But this one is life changing…..Everything about this earphone is great,not even one single downsize I can name …Price point ,battery life life is great,sounds great,very pretty,digital screen that showed the battery life is cherry on the top…Very comfortable to wear…You name it …. This might be the best purchase I made on amazon,and I have been shopping here more than 10 years…But now :)

Title: Budget-Friendly and Durable
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2024
Body: I opted for these Bluetooth headphones instead of splurging on AirPods, fearing I'd inevitably lose them—and guess what? I haven't lost them yet! Surprisingly, these headphones have exceeded my expectations in terms of both quality and durability.I was pleasantly surprised by the sound quality and overall performance of this product, especially considering its affordable price point. But the real shocker came when I accidentally ran one of the headphones through the washer. Despite the mishap, it continued to work perfectly fine afterward!This experience has reaffirmed my belief that you don't need to spend a fortune on Apple products to get a reliable pair of headphones. These Bluetooth headphones are proof that quality and durability can come at an affordable price. Don't hesitate to give them a try!Overall Rating: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Title: Crisp, clear and comfy
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2024
Body: First off this is my very first pair of these kind of ear buds, and I am impressed… They’re comfortable which I was nervous about because a lot of the older buds (the ones that came with iPhone) never fit my ears right. I have small ear holes or something. The first song I chose to listen to was Bottle and Mary Jane by Jelly Roll. It sounds great! I paid less than $30 and I gotta say they’re worth every penny. I cannot compare them to more expensive buds because I’ve not used them.  But these are perfect for me because I won’t be  using them much. I don’t care about name brands or having the product of the moment. If they don’t last or if I start having issues I will update this, as I just got these 2 days ago.

Title: These are EXACTLY WHAT I NEEDED!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2024
Body: My expensive pair of Air Pods fell in half right after the warranty expired. I no longer had a desire to pay for mediocre headphones that loss their effectiveness more and more overtime. I ordered two low cost headphones on amazon (this pair being the first to be delivered) and I couldn't be happier! These fit perfectly in my ears (I have sensitive ears that will ache over an extended period of time of wearing headphones...Not with these!!! ). The sound quality if superb and I don't ever have them turned up full blast as they're really loud. I utilize them to listen to audio books and podcasts for 8 hours at work and they've never died. I use one at a time and I don't even need to switch sides within those 8 hours. I charged the case the day I received them and that was a week and a half ago and I still haven't recharged them. Talking on the phone voice clarity is great and I have had no issues. Connectivity is easy and consistent. These will be my go to!

Title: Excellent low cost earbuds
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2024
Body: I read and watched lots of great reviews prior to buying these. So far my experience has lived up to those reviews. I'm pretty impressed with the sound quality of these earbuds. The battery life is quite long, and I can get several full recharges out of the case before needing to plug it in. They are comfortable in the ear, and stay in easily.If I could suggest anything, it would be a larger option for the earbud insert. The biggest one in the pack works for me, but I can still feel some wiggle room that perhaps a larger insert would take care of.I will point out these are not meant to eliminate all outside noise, but dampens it down quite a bit. If I have these in while using a lawn mower, I can still hear music but not super clearly. You may want to consider an over the ear headphone if that's the intended use.Overall I am very happy with these and definitely recommend them!

Title: You get what you pay for ...
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2024
Body: After putting my airpods Gen 2 (by accident) through the wash cycle i needed to get a replacement but didn't want to drop another $90. So i found these on here. Here's my personal review:The Good:- Cheap-ish- Easy to setup / first Connect to iPhone 14 proThe Bad:- Sound quality is not good and tinny- As other have mentioned the ear pods will stop playing at the slightest touch- They sometimes wont start playing again without disconnecting and reconnecting- They don't stop auto-play when removed from ears- They wont take an incoming calls (or notify you) when playing music- Case and ear bud design is not intuitive and difficult to grip to remove from case and put back in- The battery charger levels were not accurateI tried to like these for over 3 months, but just gave up and went back to a backup wired iphone headphones due to quality and ease of use. Ive now bought another set of iPhone Gen 2's to replace this and the difference is very noticeable in all aspects. I'll just need to be more careful in the future.All in all you get what you pay for. Cheap for a reason.

Title: No longer able to charge the charging case
Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2023
Body: The first day I received them, the charging case was down to 91.  I plugged it into the charging cable that was included and it would not charge.  It stayed at 91 for several mins.  I kept opening and closing the case still nothing.  I then removed the earbuds from the case and plugged it back.  It immediately started charging.  It charged up to 100% within a few mins.  I used the earbuds that night and the next morning put the earbuds back into the case to charge.  When I connected them to my phone today, my phone's Bluetooth showed the earbuds charged to 100%.  The case itself is now showing it's charge at 86.  So I plugged it in and tried charging it.  It will not charge now.  It just stays blinking at 86 when you plug it in.  I bought a wireless charger, still will not charge.  I have plugged it into a couple different USB-C chargers, still will not charge.  I removed the earbuds again, still will not charge.I actually spoke to their customer service regarding the issue yesterday of not being able to charge the case unless I remove the earbuds. I'm not sure why they're not understanding me, however, the final response from them said it could've been a misreading on the case.  At that time, I just figured I'd deal with it.  Unfortunately today, I'm not able to charge the case at all.  I did register the earbuds through Tagry online, so I will just contact them and see what the next step is.  I will update the review after I speak to them again.  I originally was going to give these earbuds 1 star, but upgraded to 2 stars because their customer service was really nice and tried really hard to troubleshoot the issue.Also there is zero noise cancellation.  I can't remember if it stated it had noise cancellation or not, but it doesn't.  You can clearly hear everything around you.  I also keep hearing a poping noise when I please the earbud in my ear.  I'm not sure what that it.  The sound is alright.  It's definitely not crystal clear and the bass isn't anything to get excited over.  I have another pair of earbuds from another brand that sounds much better.  These are actually pretty comfortable to wear which is what I wanted.  The battery life is ok I guess.  I used the earbuds to fall asleep in and after a few hours they were down to 68.  I was hoping the battery life would've been better.  At least they didn't die after only a couple of hours.  Honestly you get what you pay for.  I didn't expect anything phenomenal, but I didn't expect to have any charging issues right off the bat.

Title: Not the greatest, but good enough, and comfy for the price
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
Body: Update after 2 months: they're starting to fail already, so dropped my review down from 4 to 1. I had no trouble with them for the first month, but now I'm getting complaints from people I'm talking on the phone with that in the middle of our phone call they can't hear me at all, or become so garbled they can't hear me. Those complaints are getting more frequent, too. Now at the 2 months mark the audio connection is also getting spotty, where the music I'm listening to will cut out for a second here and there.I had a pair of Yeteky "Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth Headphones with Wireless Charging Case 32H" which were of better sound quality and had better touch button responsiveness, but they hurt my ears. I gave those to my husband and got these instead. These have a better battery life and are way more comfortable for me, but the touch button is hit and miss and I can definitely hear a little sound distortion. If you have bigger ears, maybe go for the other brand I mentioned? But for my ears I'll sacrifice some quality for a cheap alternative that doesn't cause pain.

Title: Hard to turn off and on
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
Body: Overall I'm unsatisfied.  For being a well reviewed item I would've thought it would be much easier to control the functions.  There's no easy way to adjust volume or turn off/on.  Of course when I try adjusting them in my ears they always seem to turn off and when I try to turn them on I end up having to attempt the process a dozen times or more to get them to work.  The sound is comparable to others on the market, nothing exceptional but by no means poor, fair for the price which is why I didn't rate 1 star.  But there should be a clickable button if they can't get their touch button to work better than this.  I've had these for more than a month and waited to review so I could give myself enough time to make sure it wasn't a learning curve too, it wasn't.  There were a few times I got them to work easy, but a majority of the time I end up tinkering with them for a minute or two just to get them to work at all.  Calibration with phone was easy however.  Maybe I just received a defective set.  But I'm already looking for a new set because I can't stand needing to fuss with them as much as I have to just to get them to do what I want.  I'd spend the money on a better set if I were you.

Title: Stopped working. Too many issues.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
Body: I bought these because the reviews and the price were great. Well, they worked for a couple weeks and the sound quality was very good, but then the right side ear bud stopped working for some reason.Good thing I kept the box and they come with a lifetime warranty so I contacted the manufacturer. They suggested I clean the charging contacts. That didn't work. I sent them all the info they requested, including a video showing there was no reaction from the case when placing the buds inside or even removing them. That was enough evidence for them to send me a brand new replacement. They even offered color options. Great customer service!!I received my replacement buds fairly quickly. Its been about a month and they just started disconnecting for no reason. I was listening to music yesterday and they just disconnected. I thought that maybe I was too far away from the case so I didn't think much more of it.Well, I was sitting at my desk, just now, listening to music with the case right next to me they just disconnected. The case is 73% charged and the earbuds have been sitting in the case all night. There should be no reason why they would just disconnect.I'm over these earbuds. Too many issues. It's not even worth getting a new pair through the lifetime warranty because the next pair is going to have issues as well.I think I'm going to stay old school and use wired headphones.

Title: Will just stop working
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
Body: I really enjoyed the headphones in the beginning. The one downside I had initially was that they picked up every single sound around that. They were not noise canceling, nor did they make it easier for the person I was talking to to hear me. Most of the time when I was talking to a person I take them out and just bring my phone to my ear. They're not really great for having a conversation with someone over the phone I have found. I had put my headphones down for maybe a month, and pick them up and they refuse to pair with my phone. They cannot even be found by my phone. I found this to be a waste of money. I haven't even have them a year before this.There is no actual way to contact customer service, nor is there any troubleshooting advice online about how to fix the issue. Do not recommend if you are looking for long term ear buds

Title: Good Enough But.....
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
Body: I don't particularly like wireless ear buds/wrap around because the few that I have tried don't fit my ear. These did fit my ear, however the sound quality is muffled. They're OK for the 30 bucks, however, as time passed I noticed that I have a hard time hearing anything even with the volume turned all the way up unless I manually close whatever app I'm using and start again. Also the sound to visual is always off a couple nanoseconds or whatever.  That's visually annoying. Those are the main dislikes for me. Battery power seems to last a long time but I also don't use them much.

Title: Too big for my ears
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2023
Body: The reviews were great and I needed a replacement for my Air Pods that stopped charging/connecting to my phone. I didn't want to pay that much again when there are so many options, so I tried these. From the first day, I wasn't a fan. They are too big for my ear canals and slowly work their way out as I wear them, meaning I'm constantly having to adjust them. Which is annoying if I'm doing something that prevents me from adjusting (cooking) and means that they shut off the second I touch them, requiring me to restart whatever I'm listening to. Which is crazy because sometimes when they fall out/I take them out, they keep playing even though they're no longer in my ears. I don't get it. Worse is that they are super sensitive to wind. I like to walk outside to get in my steps, and if it's at all windy, they cut in and out the entire time. So much that there have been a couple times they've gotten out of synch and I'm listening to my audiobook in stereo. It's awful. I wore them on the airplane on the way back from vacation hoping I could get some sleep, and my ears hurt so bad by the time we landed that for the next flight I just took out my corded ear phones.I've only had them for a little over two weeks and I've already ordered a different pair because I hate these so much.The only good thing? One worked its way out of my ear while I was cleaning my pool and fell in, and it took me a few minutes to find it. It still works! Which is insane. So they're waterproof and maybe if you have bigger ear canals and don't want to walk in the wind they'll be okay, but for me, these did not work at all.

Title: Great for about 3 months
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2023
Body: First and foremost, these earbuds have great audio quality and resonance, as well as sound buffering to neutralize outside noise. These are the pros, however the cons certainly outweigh them.In terms of UI, the touch-control doesn’t seem to have any sense of designation - meaning that if you brush against the earbuds, readjust them, or even simply hold them to converse with somebody - they will acknowledge this as an attempt to either change song, adjust volume, start/stop music, etc.This isn’t the crux of the issue, though.The key issue with these earbuds is the charging case malfunctioning. Maybe I have a defective set, maybe it’s an industry setting fault. When you place the earbuds into the charging case it charges the ear pieces (hence the name, obviously), and it displays for the user when one bud is finished charging. Sounds great and would be a fantastic tool, and it worked as described for the initial 3 months; however, after this period the right earbud seems to need continuous charging. I’ll see it displayed on the exterior of the charging case and it will continue to do so until the case itself is out of power, at which point it is more or less defunct. This issue takes about 12-24hours to drain the battery. Now, this is not a huge problem given the time frame, but I have to keep it on the charger at all times, which defeats the purpose of the charging case.I have tried everything from cleaning both the earbuds and the case, thoroughly, adjusting the metallic charging prongs to ensure one is not jammed, etc., but all to no avail.Good product, but certainly better products out there. Should mine simply be defective, then I would rate this a 4 star product given the UI issues.

Title: Cute, but battery dies very quickly.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2023
Body: I bought these to replace my first identical pair that I ordered and received last week because I had misplaced a different pair that worked wonderfully. When the battery ran down quickly, I found my original earbuds and processed a return. I was given the option to get a new pair or a refund, and decided that maybe the new pair would work better.The reviews I had read boasted that the battery life for this model was long and that they also had q good and clear mouthpiece. I recieved this pair yesterday and waited until this morning to open the package and make sure I charged them and the battery pack before I used them. The battery pack went from “100%” to “70%” and then back up to “100%” as it was connected to a power source. I took the earbuds out and carried them around the house for the day, but only used them for a couple of phone calls. Then, this evening I put them on to listen to an audiobook. About 30 minutes in, the prompt “The battery needs to be charged” started and repeated itself in a couple of minutes. I'm sending this set back as well. Disappointing!

Title: Good for the price
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
Body: Good for the price, however there are SOME issues.If you have tiny or sensitive ears, these are not comfortable. I'm unfortunately unable to wear them for periods longer than 40-ish minutes due to how paiful they are to wear. This is just an issue with my ears, but if you are like me and you are determined to get these, wear them upside down. It's significantly less painful.The audio is loud. Even on the lowest setting, these things are pretty loud. I have autism and when im having a sensory overload, the lowest settings of these are very painful. Wholeheartedly recommend using these with an app like spotify where it allows you to lower the volume further via the app.The touch sensors on the side are SO SENSITIVE. My hair manages to trigger them, yet when I actually want to skip a song or pause and play my music, it doesn't work to well and can lead to some frustration.The audio quality itself seems okay. It's definitely not like my more expensive over-the-ear headphones, but it isn't grating or awful. I don't use these for calls,  so I'm not too sure about the mic quality.Battery life is pretty nice, the overall feel of the earbuds in my hands are nice also. The case feels a little cheap on the outside, but not to the point where I feel like the lid is going to break off. Just be careful not to drop them.I like the color and appearance of them! They look exactly like the picture. I haven't had any issues with the case or charging, but please be aware when you first turn it all on, the case battery is going to drop very quickly to charge the headphones.The earbuds come with a lifetime warranty you can activate for free. I reached out to customer support regarding a question, and they replied within the next business day and were very helpful.TL;DR:Hurts tiny ears, loud minimum audio, touch gestures kinda suck... buuutttt audio itself good for the price, the earbuds come with a free lifetime warranty, battery life is nice, they look exactly as advertised, customer service is quick and efficient.Overall 4/5⭐️

Title: GREAT build quality, BUT .... (UPDATED: Excellent Customer Service!)
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2024
Body: (UPDATE: Right after expressing my concerns with the sound quality, customer service reached out to see how they could help! I added a star because it's REFRESHING when customer service is actually great!)... it's got issues.At the time of writing, I'm writing this review, mostly because this product has SO much promise, but it has two issues that left me disappointed. Also, for preface, I'm a filmmaker who also makes music, so I'd say I have a good ear for sound.First, the good: The build quality is EXCELLENT, especially for the price! It's a bit bigger than some competitors, but it's really light and well-made. The screen is helpful, and the earbuds themselves feel solid. Bluetooth connectivity is straightforward as well!Now, onto my critiques: A smaller one, but still important, but the noise cancelling just doesn't work on this. While it does a good job blocking out sound, I've had friends and family members complain about my microphone when calling. The product actually lists that it has some sort of noise canceling for calls, but it's nothing really special.But that's not my biggest problem.It's just the sound is SO off! Some people might be able to get used to it, but I can't. It was really shocking because the first impressions were great, and I don't get why so many people have reviewed this so positively. As someone who listens to a wide range of music (hip hop, rock, pop, even traditional East Asian music!), the earbuds do a poor job of outputting a clear sound. The mix is REALLY muddy, especially at the low frequencies. Basses really mess up male vocals, and high frequencies are airy. The mids seem completely missing, almost like the inverse of what you'd hear through a phone!If they can just adjust their EQ to sound fuller (and maybe tone down the bass), then these would be INCREDIBLE. Again, I'm SHOCKED that this has as many positive reviews. I'd rather buy $8 wired earbuds over these. This product has HUGE POTENTIAL, but completely WASTED buy the actual sound quality.(And no, I will not be downloading EQ's specifically for these earbuds. I have too many devices)The Tozo T6 (my previous earbuds) are a great alt at this price point (whenever it's on sale at least), but since I wanted to try something new, I'm sticking with the JBL Vibes. They sound great :)

Title: Price so good...sound so bad
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2024
Body: For $35? These are incredible. I'm planning on buying 2 or 3 more to give as gifts. The interchangeable ear cups let you customize the fit and the little screen on the case that shows the battery level is nifty--Apple should have this feature. Since you can buy three of these for the cost of only one pair of the basic Airpods--they're awesome. The sound quality is just terrible! I found that changing the EQ settings on my iPhone helps a bit depending on the type of music you are listening to. These don't noise cancel at all.  They feel cheap. The plastic on the case is rough--not smooth like Airpods. The case is flimsy. I'm worried that flipping it open and shut often could lead to it breaking. The earbuds themselves are so light in your hand--very easy to drop. I'm confident these will work great for what I bought them for--listening to music in the gym and podcasts while I'm folding laundry--and I built that assumption into my purchase--I didn't expect great sound. If you're settling in to really listen to music and drown out noise in a coffee shop, these are not for that.

Title: Good quality
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2024
Body: I ordered these earphones yesterday after I spent some time reading the reviews. I was a bit scepitable due to the price and some of the reviews. They were delivered the same day I ordered them. I opened the box to find them 100% charged! I put them in my ears fit was great and I can walk and move without them falling out of my ears. It was an easy set up with my Samsung s10. I haven't utilized any of the buttons yet. I tried the volume today per the booklet, but was unable to get it to work. I find it easier to use the phone volume button. I don't plan to use these for calls only music. I find the music quality = in both ears. I went out in my backyard and was able to walk freely without losing the connection. I left the phone in the house and was able to get about 25 ft until it wasn't commuicating with the phone. I was digging up some small tree roots and the earpieces remained in except once. It loosened in my ear and when i pressed it back in it stopped the music. Me not wanting to figit with the button to figure it out I chose to walk to my phone. In the coming days I will explore the buttons, but not today.

Title: May as well be Michael Phelps
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2024
Body: Comfort: 5/10Sound Quality: 6/10Convenience: 8/10I kind of hated these when I first bought them because they weren’t the best in comfort or sound quality but used them because $40 is $40.However, they’re powered by like…. Idk radioactive rabbits or something. They charge super fast and the charge lasts around at least 7 business days.But also, they are truly truly water proof. How do I know? Because I’m a mom of a nasty lil 9yo and a potty training 2yo and LAUNDRY is taking over my house. I pretty much just load up the forklift, drop the clothes in, and have a fun lil scavenger hunt after the clothes come out. These sweet lil headphones didn’t deserve to go through the washer with my kids crap stains and half eaten suckers, but they did. And they came out of the washer as if they hadn’t just been traumatized.Props.

Title: Sounds good!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2024
Body: The earbuds were delivered quickly in a nice box, reminiscent of Apple packaging. The instructions were straightforward and concise. The earbuds fit very well into a nice carrying case that includes a battery indicator for the case as well as indicators that the earbuds are charging. The case has kept a good charge and has only been charged once since I got them. However, I only use the earbuds for a short time every day at this point.The only problem I have with the earbuds is that it’s difficult to determine where exactly to tap to change volume, track, answer my phone, etc. I think that will work itself out as I use them more.

Title: Falls out. Good sound and battery life
Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
Body: Moved on to these after old airpods not keeping charge. They're a lot bigger. They tend to fall out of my ears when I talk, bend down, chew or move rapidly. When I adjust the placement while wearing them they turn off the audio or switch tracks, but I cannot seem to get the hang of changing tracks or turning off the audio etc while they're in. My ear did get sore where the earbud changes size from small inner ear portion to the larger portion that hangs out of the ear. They tend to build up moisture in the ear canal. Not that it's unbearable but it's a different experience and I'll have to be diligent in keeping the earbuds super clean.The sound is good. They're not completely noise cancelling which is good for my needs. I have not tried them in very noisy environments though.The microphone is good for calls but voice to text seems to have difficulties. It could be an issue with something I'm doing but it's an issue I'm having nonetheless.The battery life is surprisingly good. I like the fact that the battery life is shown on the outer case. No guessing when you might need to charge it.The case is a bit bigger than I expected but it's easier to find when it wants to fall to the bottom of a bag or backpack.

Title: Best backup set I've owned
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2024
Body: I've tried dozens of bluetooth earbuds; brands and styles, cheap and expensive.  I don't need tons of features, but I do need earbuds that don't fall out when working out.  My Anker Soundcore X10 are my go-to @ $70.  But these TAGRY earbuds are half the price, connect easy, have a long charge, and DON'T fall out of my ears.  If I could give a star rating for "fit" it would be a 5.  Make no mistake, this set does not have active noise cancelling or really dynamic clear sound.  They work and they stay in my ear at the gym.  Great find at this price point.

Title: Great headphones for the price
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2024
Body: These are great, reliable headphones for the price.  Easy to connect, audio sounds great.  When comparing to the Apple Airpods, however, the only drawback is that after wearing them for over an hour, they are not as comfortable as the Airpods.  There is an indescribable comfort with the Apple Airpods - you almost forget you're wearing them.  I've tried several different sizes of the silicone caps, however, no matter the size - over time, they are not comfortable.

Title: Great battery life, but too loud
Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
Body: I bought these to listen to audible while going to sleep. I like to listen to stories to lull me to sleep. My headphones hurt my ears, so I wanted something small that would be more comfortable to sleep. I disliked that these were way too loud on the lowest setting. The volume on the lowest setting is like a medium setting.They are comfortable and I decided to use them for walking in my neighborhood instead. They block out car noise, so I am able to still use them. I got them on sale around Christmas. I like the pink color. The battery life is good, about 6 hours, then you can put them back in the rechargeable case and get several more 6 HR charges from one charge from the case. I think around 40 to 60 hrs in total. Would recommend if you don't mind loud ear buds.
